section.description: SQL syntaxes vary widely between vendors. Function implementations vary even more so. The set of functions below are deemed "Portability" functions. If these functions are used in a SQL statement parsed by one of the Xbasic SQL objects, the appropriate target function for the selected syntax handler is generated automatically by the object when the query is executed. Any argument re-ordering is done by the syntax handler. Not all back-end databases support all of these functions. Known incompatibilities are noted. If you use a function that Portable SQL does not recognize, it will pass it through to the back-end database. You will get whatever error the database provides.

case.description: Returns the absolute value of Number.

case.title: AddSecondsToDateTime( Time_Expression )

case.title: AddYearsToDate( Date_Expression )

case.title: Atan( Number )

case.title: Character( Value1 [, Value2... ] )
case.description: Returns character value of a numeric expression. Not Supported by Informix, Ingres

case.title: Concatenate( String1, String2 [, StringN ... ] )
case.description: Concatenates the character strings and returns the result.

case.title: Cos( Number )
case.description: Returns the Cosine of Number in radians.

case.title: CoT( Number )

case.title: Count( ALL | Filter_Expression )
case.description: Calculates the count of all rows or all rows that satisfy Filter_Expression.

case.title: CurrentDate()
case.description: Returns the current Date according to the SQL database server. Not Supported by Firebird

case.title: CurrentDateTime()

case.title: CurrentTime()
case.description: Returns the current Time according to the SQL database server. Not Supported by Firebird

case.title: CurrentUser()
case.description: Returns the ID of the current user according to the SQL database server.

case.title: Database()
case.description: Returns the current database name.

case.title: Day( Date_Expression | Date_Time_Expression )

case.title: DayName( Date_Expression )

case.description: Returns the day number of the week.

case.title: DayOfYear( Date_Expression | Date_Time_Expression )

case.title: DaysBetweenDateTimes( Date_Time_Expression1, Date_Time_Expression2 )
case.description: Returns the number of days between Date_Time_Expression1 and Date_Time_Expression2.

case.title: Degrees( Radians )
case.description: Returns the degrees equivalent of Radians. Not Supported by Oracle, Informix, Firebird, Access, Ingres

case.description: Returns the number e raised to the power of Number. Not Supported by Firebird

case.title: Floor( Number )
case.description: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to Number. Not Supported by Ingres, Informix

case.description: Returns the hour component of Date_Expression or Date_Time_Expression.

case.title: HoursBetweenDateTimes( Date_Time_Expression1, Date_Time_Expression2 )

case.title: If( Expression, TrueValue, FalseValue )
case.description: Returns TrueValue or FalseValue based on the evaluation of Expression.

case.title: IfNull( Expression, Replacement_Value )

case.title: Left( String, Count )
case.description: Returns Count characters from the beginning of String. Not Supported by Firebird, Oracle, OracleLite, PostgreSQL, Informix

case.description: Returns the natural logarithm of Number.

case.title: Log10( Number )

case.title: Lower( String )
case.description: Changes all upper case characters to lower case and returns the result.

case.title: LTrim( String )

case.title: MinutesBetweenDateTimes( Date_Time_Expression1, Date_Time_Expression2 )

case.title: Month( Date_Expression | Date_Time_Expression )

case.title: MonthName( Date_Expression | Date_Time_Expression )
case.description: Returns the month name of a Date_Expression or Date_Time_Expression.

case.title: MonthsBetweenDates( Date_Expression1, Date_Expression2 )
case.description: Returns the months between Date_Expression1 and Date_Expression2.

case.title: MonthsBetweenDateTimes( Date_Time_Expression1, Date_Time_Expression2 )
case.description: Returns the months between Date_Time_Expression1 and Date_Time_Expression2.

case.title: NextDay( Date_Time_Expression )
case.description: Returns the day after Date_Time_Expression as a Date_Time_Value.

case.title: Now()
case.description: Returns the current time as a Date_Time_Value.

case.title: Pi()
case.description: Returns an approximate value of Pi. Not Supported by Oracle, DB2

case.title: Position( Find_String, Search_In_String )
case.description: Returns the position of Find_String within Search_In_String.

case.title: Power( Number, Exponent )
case.description: Raises Number to the Exponent power. Not Supported by Firebird

case.title: Quarter( Date_Time_Expression )
case.description: Returns the quarter of the year that contains Date_Time_Expression.

case.title: Radians( Degrees )
case.description: Converts a number in Degrees to radians. Not Supported by Oracle, Informix, Firebird, Access, Ingres

case.title: Rand()
case.description: Returns a random value between 0 and 1. Not Supported by Oracle, Informix

case.title: Replace( Search_in_String, Search_For_String [, Replace_String ] )
case.description: Replaces all occurrences of Search_For_String with Replace_String in Search_in_String. Not SUpported by Ingres, firebird

case.title: Right( String, Count )
case.description: Returns Count characters from the end of String. Not Supported by Firebird, Oracle, OracleLite, PostgreSQL, Informix

case.title: Round( Number, Places )
case.description: Rounds off a Number to Places decimal places. Not Supported by Firebird, Ingres

case.title: RTrim( String )
case.description: Removes white space characters after the String.

case.title: Second( Date_Expression | Date_Time_Expression )
case.description: Returns the seconds value of a Date_Expression or Date_Time_Expression.

case.title: SecondsBetweenDateTimes( Date_Time_Expression1, Date_Time_Expression2 )
case.description: Returns the seconds between Date_Time_Expression1 and Date_Time_Expression2.

case.title: SessionUser()
case.description: Returns the name of the session user according to the SQL database server.

case.title: Sign( Number )
case.description: Returns 1 if Number is positive, 0 if zero, and -1 if negative. Not Supported by Informix, Ingres

case.title: Sin( Number )
case.description: Returns the Sine of Number in radians.

case.title: Square( Number )
case.description: Returns the square of Number.

case.title: SquareRoot( Number )
case.description: Returns the square root of Number.

case.title: StdDev( ALL | Filter_Expression )
case.description: Calculates the standard deviation of all rows or all rows that satisfy Filter_Expression.

case.description: Returns the length of String.

case.description: Returns a string right padded with PadString to a length of Length characters.

case.title: StringPadLeft( String, Length, PadString )
case.description: Returns a string left padded with PadString to a length of Length characters.

case.title: SubString( String, Position, Length )
case.description: Returns the portion of String starting at Position and extending Length characters.

case.title: Sum( ALL | Filter_Expression )
case.description: Returns the sum of all rows or all rows that satisfy Filter_Expression.

case.title: SystemUser()
case.description: Returns the name of the system user according to the SQL database server.

case.title: Tan( Number )
case.description: Returns the Tangent of Number in radians.

case.title: Truncate( Number1, Number2 )
case.description: Returns Number truncated to Number2 decimal places.

case.title: Upper( String )
case.description: Changes all lower case characters to upper case and returns the result.

case.title: Variance( ALL | Filter_Expression )
case.description: Returns the variance of all rows or all rows that satisfy Filter_Expression.

case.title: Week( Date_Expression | Date_Time_Expression )
case.description: Returns the week number of a Date_Expression or Date_Time_Expression.

case.title: Year( Date_Expression | Date_Time_Expression )
case.description: Returns the year of a Date_Expression or Date_Time_Expression.

case.title: YearsBetweenDates( Date_Expression1, Date_Expression2 )
